SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.evaluation

Class DatasetEvaluatorBuilder

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.evaluation.DatasetEvaluatorBuilder
public class DatasetEvaluatorBuilder extends Object
Builder for creating DatasetEvaluator instances.

This builder provides a fluent API for configuring and creating evaluators that combine FHIRPath expression evaluation with a Spark Dataset. It uses SingleResourceEvaluatorBuilder internally to create the underlying evaluator.

Usage Example


 DatasetEvaluator evaluator = DatasetEvaluatorBuilder
     .create(ResourceType.PATIENT, fhirContext)
     .withDataset(patientDataset)
     .withVariables(Map.of("myVar", myCollection))
     .build();

 CollectionDataset result = evaluator.evaluate(fhirPath);
See Also:
  • DatasetEvaluator
  • SingleResourceEvaluatorBuilder

  • Method Details

    • create

      @Nonnull public static DatasetEvaluatorBuilder create(@Nonnull String subjectResourceCode, @Nonnull FhirContext fhirContext)
      Creates a builder for the specified resource type code.

      This method supports both standard FHIR resource types (e.g., "Patient", "Observation") and custom resource types registered with HAPI (e.g., "ViewDefinition").

      Parameters:
      subjectResourceCode - the subject resource type code
      fhirContext - the FHIR context
      Returns:
      a new builder

    • create

      @Nonnull public static DatasetEvaluatorBuilder create(@Nonnull Enumerations.ResourceType subjectResource, @Nonnull FhirContext fhirContext)
      Creates a builder for the specified resource type.
      Parameters:
      subjectResource - the subject resource type
      fhirContext - the FHIR context
      Returns:
      a new builder

    • withDataset

      @Nonnull public DatasetEvaluatorBuilder withDataset(@Nonnull Dataset<Row> dataset)
      Sets the dataset to evaluate against.

      The dataset should have a flat schema where resource fields are top-level columns (e.g., id, name, gender, birthDate, ...).

      Either this method or withDataSource(DataSource) must be called before build().

      Parameters:
      dataset - the Spark Dataset containing the resource data
      Returns:
      this builder for method chaining

    • withDataSource

      @Nonnull public DatasetEvaluatorBuilder withDataSource(@Nonnull DataSource dataSource)
      Sets the data source to read the dataset from.

      When a DataSource is provided, the dataset will be read from it using the subject resource code during build(). This is a convenient alternative to calling `dataSource.read(resourceCode)` and then using withDataset(Dataset).

      Either this method or withDataset(Dataset) must be called before build().

      Parameters:
      dataSource - the data source to read the dataset from
      Returns:
      this builder for method chaining

    • withVariables

      @Nonnull public DatasetEvaluatorBuilder withVariables(@Nonnull Map<String,Collection> variables)
      Sets the variables available during FHIRPath evaluation.

      Default is an empty map.

      Parameters:
      variables - the variables map
      Returns:
      this builder for method chaining

    • withFunctionRegistry

      @Nonnull public DatasetEvaluatorBuilder withFunctionRegistry(@Nonnull FunctionRegistry functionRegistry)
      Sets the function registry for resolving FHIRPath functions.

      Default is StaticFunctionRegistry.getInstance().

      Parameters:
      functionRegistry - the function registry
      Returns:
      this builder for method chaining

    • withCrossResourceStrategy

      @Nonnull public DatasetEvaluatorBuilder withCrossResourceStrategy(@Nonnull CrossResourceStrategy crossResourceStrategy)
      Sets the strategy for handling cross-resource references.

      Default is CrossResourceStrategy.FAIL.

      Parameters:
      crossResourceStrategy - the cross-resource strategy
      Returns:
      this builder for method chaining

    • build

      @Nonnull public DatasetEvaluator build()
      Builds the DatasetEvaluator with the configured options.

      If a DataSource was provided via withDataSource(DataSource), the dataset will be read from it. Otherwise, the dataset must have been provided via withDataset(Dataset).

      Returns:
      a new DatasetEvaluator instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if neither dataset nor dataSource has been set
